title: Problem Overview
content:
**Erdős Problem #844: Maximum Set with Non-Squarefree Products**

Let A ⊆ {1,...,N} such that for all a,b ∈ A, ab is not squarefree.

**Question:** Is the maximum achieved by A = even numbers ∪ odd non-squarefree?

**Answer: YES** (Weisenberg; Alexeev-Mixon-Sawin)

The key insight: among squarefree numbers, pairs must share a prime - this is an 'intersecting family' problem solved by Chvátal.
mathContext: A squarefree number has no repeated prime factors. The optimal set excludes exactly the odd squarefree numbers.

title: Non-Squarefree Product Property
content:
**HasNonSquarefreeProducts A:**

∀ a, b ∈ A, ¬Squarefree(a * b)

This is the constraint: every product of elements in A must be divisible by some p².

title: The Optimal Set
content:
**optimalSet N:**

evenNumbers N ∪ oddNonSquarefreeNumbers N

Equivalently: all numbers except odd squarefree numbers (1, 3, 5, 7, 11, 13, ...).
mathContext: This is conjectured to achieve the maximum. The formalization proves this is indeed optimal.

title: Even Products Not Squarefree
content:
**even_product_not_squarefree:**

If 2|a and 2|b and ab > 0, then ¬Squarefree(ab).

Reason: ab is divisible by 2·2 = 4, so has a repeated prime factor.
mathContext: This is why even × even works. Products are divisible by 4 = 2².

title: Non-Squarefree Inheritance
content:
**nonsquarefree_product:**

If ¬Squarefree(a) and b > 0, then ¬Squarefree(ab).

Reason: If p²|a, then p²|ab.
mathContext: This is why including all non-squarefree numbers is safe - they 'infect' any product.

title: Maximal Sets Contain Non-Squarefree
content:
**maximal_contains_nonsquarefree:**

Any maximal A with the property contains all non-squarefree numbers.

Reason: Non-squarefree n can always be added - n×m is not squarefree for any m.

title: Squarefree Product Criterion
content:
**squarefree_product_criterion:**

For squarefree a, b:
¬Squarefree(ab) ↔ ∃ prime p, p|a ∧ p|b

Two squarefree numbers have non-squarefree product iff they share a prime.
mathContext: This reduces the problem to finding 'intersecting families' of squarefree numbers.

title: Intersecting Family
content:
**IsIntersectingFamily A:**

A subset of squarefree numbers where any two elements share a prime factor.

This is the combinatorial structure at the heart of the problem.

title: Chvátal's Intersecting Family Result
content:
**chvatal_intersecting_families:**

The maximum intersecting family of squarefree numbers in {1,...,N} is the set of all even squarefree numbers.

Chvátal (1974): Maximum intersecting family = all multiples of a fixed prime. The optimal choice is 2 (maximizes density).
mathContext: This is the key external result that solves the problem. It comes from hypergraph theory.

title: Weisenberg's Proof
content:
**weisenberg_proof:**

For N ≥ 1 and any A ⊆ {1,...,N} with HasNonSquarefreeProducts A:
|A| ≤ |optimalSet N|

The optimal set achieves the maximum.

title: Alexeev-Mixon-Sawin Alternative
content:
**alexeev_mixon_sawin_proof:**

Independent alternative proof of the same result.

Published in arXiv:2507.01928 (2025).

title: Asymptotic Density
content:
**optimal_set_density:**

The optimal set has asymptotic density 1 - 4/π² ≈ 0.595.

The odd squarefree numbers (the excluded set) have density 4/π² ≈ 0.405.
mathContext: The squarefree numbers have density 6/π² ≈ 0.608, and half of them are even.

title: Example for N = 10
content:
**optimalSet 10 = {2, 4, 6, 8, 9, 10}**

- 2, 4, 6, 8, 10 are even
- 9 = 3² is odd non-squarefree
- Missing: 1, 3, 5, 7 (odd squarefree)

title: Complete Characterization
content:
**erdos_844_characterization:**

1. The optimal set has the non-squarefree product property
2. No larger set has the property
3. The optimal set = even numbers ∪ odd non-squarefree

This completely resolves Erdős Problem #844.

title: Problem Solved
content:
**Erdős Problem #844: SOLVED**

The maximum A ⊆ {1,...,N} with ¬Squarefree(ab) for all a,b ∈ A is achieved by:
- All even numbers
- All odd non-squarefree numbers

Equivalently: all numbers except odd squarefree numbers.

Key insight: Chvátal's intersecting families result determines the optimal squarefree subset.
